question_text: Which of the following best explains why DSL performance degrades with distance, while cable internet does not?
answer_options: DSL signals travel through fiber while cable uses coax
Cable uses symmetric transmission while DSL does not
DSL signal strength weakens over copper phone lines, while cable uses centralized amplification over coax
Cable internet uses Wi-Fi signals over coax which are less susceptible to distance
correct_answer: DSL signal strength weakens over copper phone lines, while cable uses centralized amplification over coax
explanation: DSL signal strength drops the farther it travels from the central office due to attenuation over copper. Cable networks use amplifiers to maintain signal quality.
